pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7037438707/job/19152208637)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7037438707/job/19152208380)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7037438707/job/19152208083)
The weakening of hypotheses here is the main point of these changes.
Naming suggestions (always welcome) especially welcome here!

Shouldn't the name be
```suggestion
@[simp] lemma ker_traceForm_eq_bot_of_isCartanSubalgebra
```
I guess the same applies to `ker_restrictBilinear_of_isCartanSubalgebra_eq_bot` which must have slipped through during the review of an earlier PR.

Does this work?
```suggestion
private lemma aux [h : Nontrivial (shiftedWeightSpace R L M χ)] : weightSpace M χ ≠ ⊥ :=
  (LieSubmodule.nontrivial_iff_ne_bot _ _ _).mp h
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: generalise results about Lie module weight spans from Abelian to nilpotent Lie algebras
